page.title: 05FARMING IN MILLAND
page.content: there are many farms in the southern part of the block, but none in the northern sandy area. the dairy herds include one of guernseys selling milk and cream locally, and several herds of friesians selling to the milk marketing board. there are also smaller herds of beef cattle and one for prize aberdeen angus bulls. the land is much cultivated, the main crops being wheat and barley, and some oil seed rape. very little hay is made nowadays from the grass it is mainly silage. this year there is an increasing number of sheep in the valley. it is said that what the farmers grow and keep depends to a certain extent on what the ministry of agriculture is offering in grants.
